meanings.definition: Skanking (verb): to dance to reggae music in a rhythmic, jerky fashion.
meanings.sent1: She was skanking joyfully at the reggae concert.
meanings.sent2: People love skanking at reggae festivals.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried skanking to the reggae beat, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: His feet moved like lightning bolts while skanking to the reggae rhythm.
meanings.sent5: Skanking involves moving your body in a lively and energetic way to reggae tunes.

meanings.definition: Skanking (noun): a style of dancing characterized by a bouncing movement.
meanings.sent1: The skanking at the party was infectious, making everyone join in.
meanings.sent2: The skanking competition showcased various styles of dance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's skanking in the living room was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her skanking was like a bouncing ball, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The skanking performance was full of energy and enthusiasm, captivating the audience.
